messages.content: Kat Boettge was selected as the East Midlands lead candidate for the European Elections in 2014 and 2019. You may recognize her from Wife Swap Brexit Special where she argued passionately to remain in the EU. "The Green Party want to remain in the EU to strengthen our fight on issues that cross borders like climate change and social injustice."

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The EU plays a significant role in tackling the climate emergency. By remaining in the EU we are part of international action to limit the worst of the upcoming climate chaos.
By remaining in the EU we are part of international action to limit the worst of the upcoming climate chaos.
The Green Party demands social justice and opposes failed austerity.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Broxtowe European election results: Change UK - 1,542, Green Party - 4,385 (we beat Labour and the Tories too!)

issues.brexitEurope: Vote for staying in the EU
issues.environment: Vote for action on climate change. The EU plays a significant role in tackling the climate emergency. By remaining in the EU we are part of international action to limit the worst of the upcoming climate chaos.
issues.health: Kat Boettge has been working as a psychotherapist within NHS services whilst raising her daughter. She knows first hand the importance of properly funding the NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: The Green Party demands social justice and opposes failed austerity.

leaflet.personalStatement: Kat Boettge is originally from Germany but came to the UK 20 years ago. She has been working as a psychotherapist within NHS services whilst raising her daughter. She knows first hand the importance of properly funding the NHS.

politicalExperience.role: East Midlands lead candidate for the European Elections

quotes.text: "The Greens have consistently been on the right side of politics, speaking out about the climate catastrophe, demanding social justice, opposing failed austerity"
